profileText: A Senator from Kansas; born in Southampton, Mass., January 3, 1816; attended Amherst College, Massachusetts, 1836-1838; moved to New York State in 1838 and taught school; returned to Southampton, Mass., in 1842; held various local offices; member, State house of representatives 1852-1853; organizer and financial agent of the New England Emigrant Aid Co.; moved to Kansas in 1854 and settled in Lawrence; moved to Atchison, Kans.; mayor of Atchison 1858-1859; member of the free State convention at Lawrence in 1859; president of the relief committee during the famine in Kansas in 1860 and 1861; upon the admission of Kansas as a State into the Union was elected as a Republican to the United States Senate; reelected in 1867 and served from April 4, 1861, to March 3, 1873; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1872; chairman, Committee on Public Lands (Thirty-ninth through Forty-second Congresses); resided in Washington, D.C., for several years; died in Whitinsville, Worcester County, Mass., August 27, 1891; interment in Forest Hills Cemetery, Boston, Mass.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Caldwell, Martha B. "Pomeroy's `Ross Letter': Genuine or Forgery?'' Kansas Historical Quarterly 13 (August 1945): 463-72.
Gambone, Joseph G. "Samuel C. Pomeroy and the Senatorial Election of 1861, Reconsidered.'' Kansas Historical Quarterly 37 (Spring 1971): 15-32.
Kitzhaber, Albert R. "Gotterdammerung in Topeka: The Downfall of Senator Pomeroy.'' Kansas Historical Quarterly 18 (August 1950): 243-78.
Langsdorf, Edgar. "S.C. Pomeroy and the New England Emigrant Aid Company, 1854-1858.'' Kansas Historical Quarterly 7 (August 1938): 227-45; (November 1938): 379-98.
Malin, James C. "Some Reconsiderations of the Defeat of Senator Pomeroy of Kansas, 1873.'' Mid-America 48 (January 1966): 47-57.
Zornow, William Frank. "The Kansas Senators and the Re-election of Lincoln.'' Kansas Historical Quarterly 19 (May 1951): 133-44.

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in Anna Elizabeth Dickinson papers, 1859-1951. Finding aid.
1865-1895. .5 linear foot. Correspondence, legal and financial papers relating to personal affairs and bribery charges brought against him by the U.S. Senate. Finding aid.
1854. Relates to activities in the Kansas territorial period and his senatorial career. Also photographs.
9 letters (1861-1870) in various collections. Finding aid.
20 letters (1854-1863) in A.A. Lawrence papers and other collections.
